valsi.definition: digit/number: 1 (digit) [one].
panra modal, 1st place (parallel; shared property) similarly; in addition to ...
sumti: explicitly marks respective use as in "THEY read THEIR (respective) books".
$b_1$ is Esperanto.
among (with a share for each)
discursive: justice - prejudice.
discursive: justice - prejudice.
binary mathematical operator: ratio; [the ratio of a to b].
location tense relation/direction; transfixing/passing through ...
$pi_1$ is a cross section/tomogram, a picture of slice $pa_1$=$pi_2$ of $pa_2$ made by $pi_3$ in medium $pi_4$.
valsi.notes: {samterpli} pa'oxra = CAT scan. There is another kind of tomogram which may be better termed {tadmijyxra}.

valsi.definition: pagbu modal, 1st place having component ...
Paris
number/quantity: 18 [eighteen].
number/quantity: 13 [thirteen].
$x_{1}$ hopes/wishes for/desires $x_{2}$ (event), expected likelihood $x_{3}$ (0-1); $x_{1}$ hopes that $x_{2}$ happens.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is hopeful of $x_2$; $x_2$ will hopefully occur, as hoped for by $x_1$; the value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); wish (= {sotpa'a}), hope (= {sorpa'a}), expect (= {sojypa'a}). See also {djica}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is the Hell of evil spirit(s) $t_2=pa_1=pr_1$, evil by standard $pa_2$.
$x_1=z_2=p_1$ is a sin/evil action by $x_2=z_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$, evil/depraved/wicked (morally bad) by standerd $x_4=p_2$.
$xl_1$ (agent) tempts $xl_2$ into evil $xl_3=p_1$ by influence/threat/lure $xl_4$, said act being evil by standard $p_2$.
$z_1$ sins by doing $z_2=p_1$ by standard $p_2$.
Dad
valsi.notes: The rafsi for {patfu} used as a familar name. See also {mam}, {bes}, {tix}, {bun}, {mes}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of $x_{2}$ [where $x_{2}$ is a whole/mass]; $x_{2}$ is partly $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ passes through/penetrates barrier/medium/portal $x_{2}$ to destination side $x_{3}$ from origin side $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)). See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=c_1$ is a tab (navigational widget) in $p_2=c_2$.
valsi.notes: x2 is usually a web browser or a text editor. Cf. {pagbu}, {canko}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=g_1$ is a constituent country of $p_2$ (sovereign state / supranational body).
digit/number: pi (approximately 3.1416...).
$j_1=p_1$ gives a verdict $j_2$ (du'u) about matter $j_3=p_2$ (abstract).
$p_1=k_1$ is a jury/judging panel deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.
$c_1$ is a member of jury/judging panel $c_2=p_1=k_1$ deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.
$x_1$ is fair/just/equitable/impartial/unprejudiced/unbiased in judging/refereeing/arbitrating/determining/deciding matter $x_2$.
$j_2$ is a verdict given by $j_1=p_1$ about matter $j_3=p_2$ (abstract).
$c_1=t_1=p_1$ is the judicial branch of the government of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter $x_{2}$ (abstract).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ includes jei = rule (jetpai), ni = estimate (lairpai), ka = evaluate (kairpai or vampai), or nu = referee/arbitrate (faurpai); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= kamnypai, as part of mass $x_1$). See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 1,000 expressed with comma.
$x_1$ gets promoted to $x_2$ (object, state).
$x_{1}$ is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ promotes $x_2$ to $x_3$ (object, state).
$x_{1}$ are pants/trousers/slacks/leggings [legged garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tray/platter/flat container [pan/sheet/griddle] of contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable. See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a Sith / Dark Jedi of power / level / rank $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material $x_{2}$.
$l_1$ (agent) washes dishes $l_2$ of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$
$c_1$ is a dishwasher (machine).
malaria.
discursive: first utterance ordinal.
$x_{1}$ is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ by means $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ fluid may be liquid or gas; $x_5$ may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that $x_3$ is a place of lower pressure, $x_4$ a place of higher pressure. (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci})

valsi.definition: quantified selbri: convert 1 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with single/sole/only member $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a papaya (fruit) of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$
$j_1$ hugs/embraces $j_2$ with $j_3$ (part of $j_1$) at locus $j_4$ (part of $j_2$).
$p_1RefEntity "amp"p_2=l_1$ (mass) date via route $l_2$ using means $l_3$.
discursive utterance ordinal: first section/chapter ordinal.
quantified selbri: convert 1 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is first among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$pr_1$=$pe_1$ is a lover of $pr_2$=$pe_2$.
number/quantity: 15 [fifteen].
$x_{1}$ is an odor/fragrance/scent/smell emitted by $x_{2}$ and detected by observer/sensor $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer. See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) punctuates $x_{2}$ (expression) with symbol/word $x_{3}$ with syntactic/semantic effect $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.
valsi.notes: Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese. See also cokcu for a generalized {absorbant}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=p_2$ is incense emitting odor $p_1$.
$g_1=p_2$ is an incense stick with odor $x_2=p_1$.
$x_1$ is a sponge of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a loofa of variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a park/land reserve managed by community/polity/company $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a slice [thin flat portion] of $x_{2}$ (mass).
number/quantity: 10 [ten].
number/quantity: 10,000,000 [ten millions](Western numbering system/1,00,00,000 [100 lakhs](Indian numbering system).
quantifier selbri: convert 10 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the decade of members $x_{2}$.
quantified selbri: convert 10 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is tenth among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
number/quantity: 100 [one hundred].
number/quantity: 100,000 [hundred thousand](Western numbering system)/[one lakh](Indian numbering system)..
quantifier selbri: convert 100 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the century of members $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is at peace with $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. jamna; use sarxe, smaji, tugni for most metaphorical extensions, cilce, jamna)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ parallels $x_{2}$ differing only in property $x_{3}$ (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is parallel to $x_2$, $x_3$ is the only difference between $x_1$ and $x_2$ (= {terpanra} for reordered places); $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike/similar/congruent. A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ protests/objects to/complains about $x_{2}$ (event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with action $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_4$ is an event or tu'a quotation) See also {xarnu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent(s) $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is filial.
number/quantity: 11 [eleven].
$x_{1}$ is a [physical] page/leaf of book/document/bound mass of pages $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Numbered pages (as in a book) are the sides of a page (= {paprysfe}, {paprysfelai}); a pageful of text (= {papryseltcidu}, {paprytcidylai}). See also {karni}, {pelji}, {prina}, {xatra}, {vreji}, {pezli}, {cukta}, {ciska}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ make up/peace with each other under condition $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (me'o, fraction) is a ratio/rate of $x_{2}$ (quantity) with respect to $x_{3}$ (quantity), [$x_{2}$:$x_{3}$].
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ fraction/proportion/quotient; $x_2$ dividend/numerator; $x_3$ divisor/denominator. See also {frinu}, {dilcu}, {mekso}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 12 [twelve].
quantified selbri: convert 12 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with a dozen members $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a parasite of $x_2$.
$k_1=c_1$ creeps/crawls to $k_2$ from $k_3$ via $k_4$ using $k_5=c_4$.
tense interval modifier: once; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
Pacific Ocean.
number/quantity: 19 [nineteen].
$x_1$ is a tunic of material $x_2$.
valsi.notes: A garment worn over the torso, with or without sleeves, and of various lengths reaching from the hips to the ankles. Originated in Greece and Ancien Rome. {tu'inka} for type 4. Cf. {pastu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a robe/tunic/gown/cloak/dress/[coveralls] [a long/full body garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$s_1=p_1$ is a dress/gown (full-length un-legged garment) of material $s_2=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a father of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ begets/sires/acts paternal towards $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is a potato [an edible tuber] of variety/cultivar $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (use samcu for starchy/tuberous roots that do not reproduce from eyes of tuber); See also {genja}, {jalna}, {samcu}.

valsi.definition: $pa_1=pe_1$ disapprovingly minds/cares $pa_2=pe_2$.
$c_1=p_1$ protests expressing $c_2$ to audience $c_3=p_3$ via medium $c_4$ about $p_2$.
$s_1=p_1$ protests/objects to/complains about $s_2=p_2$ with action $s_3=p_4$ to audience $p_3$.
$x_1=p_1$ is Protestant in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a pot/kettle/urn/tub/sink, a deep container for contents $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. tansi, palne for depth; baktu, botpi for open/lidded)

valsi.definition: $v_1=p_1$ sighs in exasperation responding to $p_2$ (event/state).
discursive: optional question premarker.
discursive: unreal/rhetorical question follows.
$p_1$ is a bond issued by $d_1$ held by $d_3$.
$b_1$ is the first Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama.
$x_1$ is a Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the reciprocal/multiplicative inverse of $x_2$ .
$c_1$ is strictly heterosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
valsi.notes: This word does not apply to bisexuals and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "heterosexual". Cf. {pavycinse}, {dutcinse}, {pavmitcinse}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is a vehicle of units x2 for monorail x3, propelled by x4.
January.
$x_1$ is January/the first month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$m_1$ is singular.
$c_1$ is strictly homosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
valsi.notes: This word does not apply to bisexuals and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "homosexual". Cf. {pavycinse}, {mitcinse}, {pavdutcinse}.

valsi.definition: $j_1$ has the rank of Lieutenant/1st Lieutenant (equivalent of NATO OF-1) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {pa}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {relmoija'a}. Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is October/the tenth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ has the rank of Field Marshall/General of the Army//Fleet Admiral/Marshall of the Air Force (equivalent of NATO OF-10) in military unit $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {pa}, {no}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {sozmoija'a}, {bivmoija'a}. Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 14 [fourteen].
$x_1$ is December/the twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ happens once in interval $x_2$.
$pr_1$ is (a) monosexual/non-bisexual.
$c_1$ is monosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
valsi.notes: Monosexual means sexual interest in only one sex/gender, so this word does not apply to bisexuals (= {relcinse}). Cf. {fetcinse}, {nakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is November/the eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
Mercury.
$p_1$ is the closest planet (default is Mercury if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$p_1=s_1$ is alone, lacking the company of $s_2$.
$c_2$ believes in one god/deity $c_1$ with dominion over $c_3$; $c_2$ is a monotheist.
$j_2$ is a monopole with end $j_1$.
$x_1$ is a unicorn.
valsi.notes: Refers specifically to animals of the unicorn species, not the result of removing a horn from a two-horned animal.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the single, unambiguous meaning of $s_2$ recognized/accepted by $s_3$; $x_2=s_2$ is unambiguous/explicit according to $x_3=s_3$.
number/quantity: 16 [sixteen].
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) potfuls in quantity.
$p_1$ is a double boiler/bain-marie containing $p_2$ made of $p_3$
number/quantity: 17 [seventeen].
$x_1$ miscarries after being pregnant with $x_2$
restrictive relative phrase marker: which is associated with ...; loosest associative/possessive.
marks a construct as figurative (non-literal/metaphorical) speech/text.
marks the following connective as joining termsets.
evidential: I opine (subjective claim).
forethought flag for mathematical expression (mex) Polish (forethought) operator.
vocative: please.
Peru.
$x_1$ are friends (of each other, distributively)
valsi.notes: This is the {jvajvo} version of {simpe'o}. cf {pendo} and {simxu}

valsi.definition: attitudinal: attitudinal question; how do you feel about it? with what intensity?.
$x_1=f_1=p_1$ is baffled/befuddled/perplexed/flummoxed by subject $x_2=p_2$; $x_1=f_1=p_1$ is stuck on problem $x_2=p_2$.
$p_1=c_1$ thinks thought $c_2=p_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept).
valsi.notes: Verbal or near-verbal expression of a thought; internal monologue. Made from {pensi} + {cusku}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ thinks back to origin/earlier state $x_3$ about $p_2$ (abstraction).
$g_1$ (agent) spreads $p_1$ over/into $p_2$ from $p_3$.
Peking
yellow fever.
$x_{1}$ is paper from source $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Sheet of paper (= {plekarda} if shape is important, {plebo'o}). See also {karni}, {papri}, {prina}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a lemon of variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an apricot [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is yellow/golden [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a poem/verse about plot/theme/subject/pattern $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject. See also {prosa}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {finti}, {lisri}, {sanga}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a limerick about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a sonnet about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a haiku about subject/theme $x_2$ by author $x_3$.
$pa_1$ is a verse of poem $pe_1$ about subject $pe_2$ by author $pe_3$ for intended audience $pe_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a pen using ink $x_{2}$ applied by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) touches $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ [a locus on $x_{1}$ or an instrument] at $x_{4}$ [a locus on $x_{2}$].
$x_{1}$ is/acts as a friend of/to $x_{2}$ (experiencer); $x_{2}$ befriends $x_{1}$.
$g_1$ introduces $p_1$ to $p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$g_1$ is a group meeting showing common property $g_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ meets/encounters $x_{2}$ at/in location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/considers/cogitates/reasons/is pensive about/reflects upon subject/concept $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is thoughtful (one sense); $x_2$ is mental (one sense)/intellectual (one sense) (= {selpei}). See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {jijnu}, {menli}, {morji}, {sidbo}, {jinvi}, se {nabmi}, {minra}, {lanli}, {besna}, {saske}, {skami}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ (set) meet at $x_2$ (location).
$x_{1}$ is a pear [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a peach of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a persimmon/ebony of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ reflects Peruvian culture/nationality in aspect $x_2$.
$p_1=k_1$ is considerate of $p_2=k_2$.
$pr_1$ is cognition (process of thought) with inputs $pr_2=pe_2$, outputs $pr_3=pe_3$, passing through stages $pr_4$.
$s_1=p_1$ hypothesizes $s_2=p_2$ to audience $s_3$ about subject/concept $x_4=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is paste/pulp/dough/mash/mud/slurry [soft, smooth-textured, moist solid] of composition $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification. See also {marxa}, {kliti}, {tarla}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $10^{15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

$x_1=p_1=c_1$ is a noodle/pasta/boiled dough eaten by $x_2=c_2$ made out of $x_3=p_2$ (normally grain(s) or legume(s)) which is boiled in $x_4=f_1$ (normally water) at temperature $x_5=f_2$ and pressure $x_6=f_3$
valsi.notes: See also {febjukpa}, {grupesxu}. luvjo from {pesxu}, {febvi}, {cidja}. Not very jvajvo, but it works.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a leaf of plant $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is foliage of $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is chlorophyll of type $x_2$; $x_1$ is chlorophyllous with type $x_2$
$t_1$ is a deciduous tree of species $t_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of sorrel of subspecies $x_2$.
digit/number: radix (number base) point; default decimal.
n-ary mathematical operator: operands are vectors to be treated as matrix rows.
Prefix multiplication of unit selbri
valsi.notes: Cf. {te'ai}. Used to construct selbri for units such as coulombs, which is pi'ai xampo snidu [ke'e] which is x1 is measured in Coulombs (Ampere-seconds) as x2 (li) etc. Since pi'ai is prefix, pi'ai mitre snidu grake [ke'e] is m s g, etc.; separate multipliers are not necessary.

valsi.definition: digit/number:separates digits for base RefEntity "gt"16, not current standard, or variable (e.g. time, date).
n-ary mathematical operator: times; multiplication operator; [(((a * b) * c) * ...)].
pilno modal, 1st place used by ...
non-logical connective: cross product; Cartesian product of sets.
$l_1$ is vaginal/penile fluid/secretion of $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a trillionth [$10^{-12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
number: too much of.
$x_1$ is a hornbill of species $x_2$.
$g_1$ takes into custody/imprisons $p_1$ as a prisoner/captive of $p_2$ restrained/held/confined by means/force $p_3$.
number: approximately all of.
$x_{1}$ is a pin/peg (needle-shaped tool) for fastening to/piercing $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$s_1$ is philosophy with methodology $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ begs/pleads/supplicates/entreats/implores/beseeches/prays [asks with humility] $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also importune, petition, plea, solicit; $x_2$ benefactor, patron; $x_3$ boon, favor, gift, alms. See also {cpedu} which is more general as to manner, {pindi}.

valsi.definition: $c_1=p_3$ (agent) comments/remarks on/observes $c_2=p_1$ about subject $x_3=p_2$ to audience $x_4=c_3=p_4$ via expressive medium $x_5=c_5$.
$x_{1}$ is a ticket entitling $x_{2}$ to entitlement/privilege $x_{3}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is the product/total/result of factors/multiplicands ($x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$) $x_{2}$ multiplied by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crust/rind/peel/skin/hide/outer cover of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. {grute}, {calku}, {skapi} (pilka as a general term includes skapi), {gacri})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ uses/employs $x_{2}$ [tool, apparatus, machine, agent, acting entity, material] for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also utilize; $x_2$ is useful/used productively by $x_1$ to do $x_3$ (= selpli for reordered places); hire/employ (= {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}). (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for $x_2$, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri})

valsi.definition: $v_1$ peels/removes skin/crust from $p_2=v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.
$d_1=p_2$ has the same feathers/plumage as $d_2$, the feathers/plumage being $p_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the feather/plume(s)/plumage [body-part] of animal/species $x_{2}$.
number: too little of.
half.
quantified selbri: convert .5 to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has a 50/50 chance under cond. $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the urine/piss/pee of $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a candirú of species/variety $x_2$.
$v_1=p_2$ (body) excretes urine/urinates/pees/pisses.
$x_{1}$ is poor/indigent/impoverished/lacking in goods/possessions/property $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a flute.
$x_{1}$ is a prisoner/captive of $x_{2}$, restrained/held/confined by means/force $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the clitoris/penis [projecting reproductive organ; body-part] of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Normally context eliminates need for specificity; otherwise: penis (= {nakpinji}), clitoris (= {fetpinji}). See also {cinse}, {gletu}, {vibna}, {plibu}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {ganti}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is bukkake onto $c_2$ from $c_3=p_2$.
$g_1$ is a penis sheath.
$j_1$ is smegma of $p_2$.
valsi.notes: Includes male and female smegma. Cf. {glevi'i}, {pinca}, {karlakse}, {lakse}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ circumcises/removes foreskin from $p_2=s_2=v_3$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {pinji}, {skapi}, {vimcu}. See also {pinjyskapi}. Also: $v_1$ is a mohel.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the foreskin of $p_2=s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a comment/remark/observation about subject $x_{2}$ expressed by $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ comments/remarks/says $x_1$ about $x_2$ (= terselpinka for reordered places). See also {jinvi}, {cusku}, {zgana}, {lanli}, {bacru}, {ciska}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a row/rank of table/chart $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a seal/sea lion/otary/walrus of genus/species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: seal: {kermipri} pinpedi; sea lion: {kerja'o} pinpedi; see also {mabru}, {odbenu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pencil/crayon/stylus applying lead/marking material $x_{2}$, frame/support [of material] $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also writing brush; $x_1$ stimulates substrate medium $x_2$ to display marks; explicitly denoting a standard lead pencil (= {tabypinsi}). (cf. ciska, penbi (unlike the English equivalents, pinsi is the more general term over penbi), burcu, bakri)

valsi.definition: $s_1=p_1$ prostrates him/herself/itself before $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is flat/level/horizontal in gravity/frame of reference $x_{2}$.
$p_1=t_1$ is a plain/flatland at location $t_2$
$v_1$ lies on $v_2=p_1$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) drinks/imbibes beverage/drink/liquid refreshment $x_{2}$ from/out-of container/source $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a row vector of dimension $x_2$ with coordinates $x_3$, $x_4$, ...
$c_1=p_1$ somersaults over $c_2$ in direction $c_3$ to $p_2$ from $p_3$.
$k_1=p_1$ skips/hops to $k_2=p_2$ from $k_3=p_3$ via route $k_4$.
$x1=p1=m1$ bounds/[moves in jumps] to $x2=p2=m2$ from $x3=p3=m3$ via route $x4=m4$ and jump height $x5=p4$
$x_{1}$ is a piano/harpsichord/synthesizer/organ; a keyboard musical instrument.
$x_1$ is a piano.
$x_1$ is piano concerto number $x_2$ in key $x_3$ composed by $x_4$ performed by/at $x_5$( event).
$p_1=b_1$ is a frog of species $b_2$.
$x_1$ is a grasshopper of order/species/breed $x_2$.
quantified selbri: convert .2 = 1/5 to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is 1/5 of mass/totality $x_{2}$.
$f_1=p_3$ paints picture $f_2=p_1$ in style/art form $l_1$ representing/showing $p_2=f_4$ on medium $p_4$
number: all of.
quantified selbri: converts all-of to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is the whole portion of mass $x_{2}$.
number: almost all of.
number: much of.
tense interval modifier: often; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
number: a little of.
tense interval modifier: rarely; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
number: at least some of.
$m_1$ is $m_2$ square kilometers on side / facing $m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
$n_1$ is a pizza with topping/ingredients $n_2$.
Python.
$x_{1}$ is a picture/illustration representing/showing $x_{2}$, made by artist $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is pictorial/illustrative; drawing (= {xraselci'a}), $x_1$ draws $x_2$ (= xraci'a/xraci'a), image (= {xratai}), photo (= {kacmyxra}), take a photo (= {kacmyterxra}, {kacmyxragau}, {kacmyxrazu'e}); sculpture, relief (= {blixra}). See also {ciska}, {cinta}, {prina}, {mupli}, {barna}, {skina}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=p_2$ is a policy by $p_1$ policy maker regarding $j_3$ subject of policy, $j_1$ is political
valsi.notes: Made out of {platu}, {javni}. Politics as an activity may be "nu plajva" and political science may be "plajva saske"

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is plump/fat/obese [excessively thick/bulbous/swollen] by standard $x_{2}$.
Planck.
$x_1$ is a plantain (small plant with flower spike) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a geranium of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a sycamore (Platanus) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a plaice of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) plans/designs/plots plan/arrangement/plot/[schematic] $x_{2}$ for state/process $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also invents/organizes; $x_2$ design, scheme; the structure or layout of an object would be represented as a state in $x_3$. See also {cartu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ pays/compensates/remunerates/[rewards] payment $x_{2}$ to recipient/payee $x_{3}$ for goods/services $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_4$ commodities; $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posle'i}, posyvelyle'i for unambiguous {semantics}); rent (= {jerle'i}, {lejyjbera}). (cf. canja, cnemu, friti, kargu, vecnu, jdima, prali, jerna, sfasa, dunda, jinga, dapma; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, cirko, dirba)

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] printed on paper with content $k_2$ published by $k_3$ for audience $k_4$.
$s_1$ is a cigarette made of $s_2$ by $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is the user-name/pseudonym/pen-name of $c_2=p_1$ for use with/by resource $c_3=p_2$ for purpose $p_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) allows the use of $p_2$ for use $x_3=p_3$ under conditions $x_4=c_3$.
$c_1=p_1$ adopts/selects/chooses/accepts $c_2=p_2$ out of alternatives $c_3$ for purpose $p_3$.
$x_1$ is able to use $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a planet revolving around $x_{2}$ with planetary characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$c_1=p_1$ is an asteroid/planetoid revolving around $p_2$ with characteristics $p_3$ and orbital parameters $p_4$.
$k_1$ is the equator of planet $x_2=p_1$ (default Earth) revolving around $p_2$
$x_1$ is a hemisphere of planet $x_2$ (default Earth) revolving around $p_2$
$x_{1}$ (agent/object) leaps/jumps/springs/bounds to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ reaching height $x_{4}$ propelled by $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Place structure parallels klama; hence $x_4$ may be a route-like expression. See also {bajra}, {stapa}, {cpare}, {lafti}.

valsi.definition: $r_1=p_1$ applies $r_2=p_2$ to $r_3=p_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an apple [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an apple tree of tree species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a plane [2-dimensional shape/form] defined by points $x_{2}$ (set); $x_{1}$ is flat/[smooth].
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is even/planar/level. ($x_2$ is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); See also {xutla}, {sefta}, {tapla}, {karda}, {boxfo}, {pinta}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a log/record of data $v_2$ (nu/du'u) about $v_3=p_1$'s use of resource $p_2$ for purpose $p_3$ recorded in medium $v_4$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] $x_{2}$ with tool $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_1$=$p_2$ is useful/good for $x_2=p_1$ by the standard of being usable for purpose $p_3$.
valsi.notes: x3 is "usable". See alse {selplika'e}. Made from {pilno} + {xamgu}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a useful word meaning/causing $v_2=x_1=p_2$, a meaning which is useful to $x_2=p_1$ for purpose $p_3$, in language $v_3$
$x_1$ is a frill-necked lizard (Chlamydosaurus) of species $x_2$.
$pi_1=po_2$ is a staple for holding together $pi_2$, made of $pi_3$
valsi.notes: cleaned up from auto noralujv migration Conceivably this might include a paper fastener as well. See {plopijnytci} for stapler.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a route/path/way/course/track to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via/defined by points including $x_4$ (set).
valsi.notes: A route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; ($x_4$ is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly). (cf. {litru}, {naxle}, {tcana}, {dargu}, {klaji}, ve {klama}; {tadji}, {zukte} for means to a goal, {klama}, {pagre})

valsi.definition: Pluto
restrictive relative phrase marker: which is specific to ...; normal possessive physical/legal.
restrictive relative phrase marker: which belongs to ... ; inalienable possession.
$x_1=p_1=d_1$ wants to own/possess/have $x_2=p_2$ for purpose $x_3=d_3$, wanting to own/possess/have it by right/custom/law $x_4=p_3$.
porsi modal, 1st place (in order) sequentially; in the sequence ...
discursive: uniquely, only, solely: the only relevant case.
selbri restrictive relative clause; attaches to a selbri with the ke'a being "me'ei the attached-selbri"
$x_1$ reflects Polish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_2$.
restrictive appositive phrase marker: which is the same thing as.
restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with identifying information to a sumti.
$x_1$ is a Pokémon/Pocket Monster of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a halibut of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (force) folds/creases $x_{2}$ at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in $x_3$, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds. See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
Poland
$p_1=b_1$ is the Japanese language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$p_1=g_1$ is Japan.
$l_1$ is the Shinto religion with beliefs/practices/tenets including $l_3$
$x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the sound of $p_1$ breaking/shattering/cracking/splintering into pieces $p_2$.
$g_1$ causes $p_1$ to break/fracture/shatter/[split/splinter/crack] into pieces $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $x_{2}$ on unordered set $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is serial. (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
Group of agents $p_3=z_1$ sequentially perform/take turns doing $z_2$ in order $p_2$ for purpose $z_3$.
$f_1$ is capital stock distributed among shareholders $p_1=f_2$ issued by company/corporation/firm $p_2$ .
$f_3$ is a/are share/shares distributed among $f_2=p_1$, issued by company/corporation/firm $f_1=p_2$ under law $p_3$.
$x_1=p_1$ claims ownership of $x_2=p_2$ in condition $p_3$.
$d_1$ is the price of possessing/owning object $d_2=p_2$ for potential owner $d_3=p_1$ from vendor $d_4$ under law/custom $p_3$
valsi.notes: {ponse}+{jdima}. This variant of {jdima} is pedantically semantic distinction between the price of "ownership" of an object rather than the price of the object itself.

valsi.definition: $f_2=p_1$ is a/are a/the shareholder(s) of company/corporation/firm $f_1=p_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$ under law $p_3$.
$p_1=b_1$ is the Portuguese language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$j_1$ is capital (factors of production) used to create goods/services $j_2=c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to $x_{2}$ accruing/resulting from activity/process $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (fe) $x_2$ profits from $x_3$ (= selterprali for reordered places); $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= selposprali for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {jinga}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {jerna}, {jdima}, {dunda}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $x_{2}$ (object/state).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is loving towards $x_2$, $x_1$ is a lover of $x_2$ (one sense), $x_2$ is beloved by $x_1$ (= selpa'i for reordered places). See also {cinmo}, {xebni}, {nelci}, {djica}, {sinma}, {pluka}, {kurji}, {pendo}, {speni}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is perfect/ideal/archetypical/faultless/flawless/un-improvable in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$b_1$ is a passenger ship for carrying $b_2$, propleed by $p_3$.
$x_1$ is a biography of $x_2$, written/created/composed by $x_3$.
$c_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the (proper) name identifying an individual person [not necessarily human] $c_{2}$=$p_{1}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: Personal name usually today comprises a given name bestowed at birth or at a young age plus a surname, but may vary culturally. Naming convention (=cmene cacyjva). See also {cmene} and {prenu}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a profile of person $d_2=p_1$ gathered by method $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ spreads/expands over/into $x_{2}$ from initial state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; $x_{1}$ displays personality/a persona.
$x_{1}$ (quoted text) is a question/query about subject $x_{2}$ by questioner $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
$v_1$ is a passenger aircraft for carrying $v_2=p_1$, propelled by $v_3$.
$j_1$ is a human right for $z_1=p_1$ to do $z_2$ (event/state).
$g_1$ (agent) prints $p_1$ onto $p_2$ using $p_3$ (tool/method).
$x_{1}$ is wise/sage about matter $x_{2}$ (abstraction) to observer $x_{3}$.
$m_1=p_3$ is a printer/printing machine for printing $p_1$ on surface $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a print/impression/image on/in surface $x_{2}$ of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is to the right/right-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.

valsi.definition: $xa_1=z_1$ is a/the right hand of $xa_2=z_2$, which faces/in-frame-of-reference $z_3$.
$x_1$ is a racoon of species/breed $x_2$.
$k_1=f_1$ is incapable of opposing $f_2$ (person/force/mass) about $f_3$ (abstract) underconditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is prose about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject. See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a proton in quantum state $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a process with inputs $x_{2}$, outputs/results $x_{3}$, passing through steps/stages $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ resource (= selru'e, but also ru'etci, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla). See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ predicts/foretells/anticipates to $x_2$ fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.
$p_1=l_1$ is preceding $p_2=l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$n_1=l_1=p_1$ is the night before $p_2=l_2$ at location $n_3$.
$d_1=p_1=l_1$ is yesterday; $d_1=p_1=l_1$ is the day preceding $p_2=l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$n_1=p_1=l_1$ is yesteryear; $n_1=p_1=l_1$ is the year preceding $p_2=l_2$ by year standard $n_3$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is elastic/springy.
$pun_1$ prepones/moves forward $pun_2$ to before $pur_2$.
$x_1$ is a prokaryote of species/defining property $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Protokaryots are a group of organisms that lack a cell nucleus. P. consists of two domains, bacteria and archaea.See also microorganism (one cellular organism;={jurme}) and eukaryote.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the ex-wife/husband of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.
time tense relation/direction: did [selbri]; before/prior to [sumti]; default past tense.
pluka modal, 1st place pleased by ...
pruce modal, 1st place (in manner 1) by process ...
modal aspect: can and has; demonstrated potential.
interval event contour: in anticipation of ...; until ... ; inchoative ----| |.
abstractor: process (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is process of [bridi] proceeding in stages $x_{2}$.
time tense: was going to; (tense/modal).
time tense: past actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: was then; (tense/modal).
$k_1$ is a gardener attending to garden $p_1$ belonging to $p_2$, growing plants $p_3$.
time tense: before and after; (tense/modal).
time tense: before and during; (tense/modal).
$x1=p1=c1$ is sweet/[pleasantly polite] to $x2=p2$ under condition $x3=p3$ by standard $x4=c3$
$x1=p2=l1$ enjoys $x2=p1=l2$
$x1=p1=m1$ is sweet/[pleasantly beautiful] to $x2=p2=m2$ under conditions $x3=p3$ by standard $x4=m4$
$b_1=p_2$ is toad of species $b_2$
$x_{1}$ is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from $x_{2}$ in medium/on surface $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a police officer/[enforcer/vigilante] enforcing law(s)/rule(s)/order $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Police officer, as an agent of authority (= {ca'irpulji}, {ka'irpulji}), as part of a police force (= {puljysoi}, as part of {puljyselsoi}); military police (= {jempulji}, {bilpulji}). See also {catni}, {sonci}, {bilni}, {flalu}, {bandu}, {jemna}, {zekri}, {krati}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function $x_{2}$ rotating on axle $x_{3}$.
$l_1$ (agent) dusts $l_2$ with $l_4$
$v_1$ contains powder of material $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) puts/places/sets $x_{2}$ on/at surface/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a swelling/protrusion/convexity [shape/form] at/in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
time tense: had earlier been; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is in the past of/earlier than/before $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is former; $x_{2}$ is latter.
valsi.notes: Time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it starts before, $x_1$ starts before $x_2$ but is continuing during $x_2$ (= {cfaprucabna}); non-aorist before, i.e. $x_1$ is over/ended before $x_2$ starts (= {fampru}), $x_1$ is completed before $x_2$ starts (= {mulpru}). See also {lidne}, {balvi}, {cabna}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer $x_{2}$ growing plants/crop $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is the last time/previous time that $x_2$ happened.
$x_{1}$ is a powder of material $x_{2}$.
$p_1=z_1$ previews $z_2$ by means $z_3$ under condition $z_4$.
$x_1$ is adolescence by standard $x_2$
$x_1$ is stellar evolution
time tense: a medium time before; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a medium length interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a short interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a long interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: a short time before; (tense/modal).
time tense: a long time before; (tense/modal).
letteral for p.
Tibet.
